intro: Pavetta platycalyx, commonly known as the broad-calyx pavetta, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, with white or pale pink petals. Pavetta platycalyx is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or rocky slopes.
